      • value

        public Integer value()
        Description copied from class: Check
        Returns the argument being tested. To be used as the last call after a chain of checks. For example: 
         Integer i = Check.that(counter, "counter").notNull().value();
        Specified by:
        value in class Check<Integer,​E extends Exception>
        Returns:
        The argument

      • intValue

        public int intValue()
        Description copied from class: Check
        Returns the argument being tested as an int. If the argument being tested actually is an int rather than an Integer, this method saves the cost of unboxing incurred by Check.value(). If the argument neither is int nor an Integer this method throws a ClassCastException.
        Overrides:
        intValue in class Check<Integer,​E extends Exception>
        Returns:
        The argument cast or converted to an int
